net.zerobandwidth.android.lib.database.querybuilder

Class UpdateBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.zerobandwidth.android.lib.database.querybuilder.QueryBuilder<UpdateBuilder,java.lang.Integer>
      • net.zerobandwidth.android.lib.database.querybuilder.UpdateBuilder

  • public class UpdateBuilder
extends QueryBuilder<UpdateBuilder,java.lang.Integer>
    Builds a SQLite UPDATE query.
    Since:
    zerobandwidth-net/android 0.1.1 (#20)
    See Also:
    SQLiteDatabase.updateWithOnConflict(String, ContentValues, String, String[], int)

      protected int m_zConflictAlgorithmID
      The numeric ID of the conflict resolution algorithm provided by Android.
      protected static java.lang.String SQL_SET 
      protected static java.lang.String SQL_UPDATE 
      static int UPDATE_FAILED
      Similar to the standard magic number returned when an insertion query fails (see SQLitePortal.INSERT_FAILED, this return value from executeOn(SQLiteDatabase) indicates that the update operation could not be carried out.

    • Field Detail

      • LOG_TAG

        protected static final java.lang.String LOG_TAG

      • UPDATE_FAILED

        public static final int UPDATE_FAILED
        Similar to the standard magic number returned when an insertion query fails (see SQLitePortal.INSERT_FAILED, this return value from executeOn(SQLiteDatabase) indicates that the update operation could not be carried out.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • m_zConflictAlgorithmID

        protected int m_zConflictAlgorithmID
        The numeric ID of the conflict resolution algorithm provided by Android. By default, no conflict resolution algorithm is requested.
        See Also:
        SQLiteDatabase.CONFLICT_ABORT, SQLiteDatabase.CONFLICT_FAIL, SQLiteDatabase.CONFLICT_IGNORE, SQLiteDatabase.CONFLICT_NONE, SQLiteDatabase.CONFLICT_REPLACE, SQLiteDatabase.CONFLICT_ROLLBACK

        public UpdateBuilder onConflict(int zAlgorithmID)
        Selects, by its numeric ID, the conflict resolution algorithm provided by Android.
        Parameters:
        zAlgorithmID - the ID of the algorithm to use
        Returns:

      • executeOn

        public java.lang.Integer executeOn(android.database.sqlite.SQLiteDatabase db)
        Executes an update query on the value that has been appended to the builder.
        Specified by:
        executeOn in class QueryBuilder<UpdateBuilder,java.lang.Integer>
        Parameters:
        db - the database instance on which the query should be executed
        Returns:
        the number of rows that were modified, or UPDATE_FAILED if the update operation could not proceed
